hero.title: AUTOHAUS: Automation that expands autonomy
hero.lead: Smart devices controlled by app, designed for greater autonomy for the elderly and people with reduced mobility.

about.title: About the project
about.lead: With the evolution of the Internet of Things (IoT), AUTOHAUS proposes a practical solution for controlling smart devices via app, prioritizing modularity and accessibility.
about.architecture_desc: Low-cost components, easy maintenance and expansion — support for multiple devices.
about.prototype_desc: Prototyping with ESP32, using motors and sensors.
about.mqtt_desc: Lightweight and secure messaging for communication between app and devices.
about.accessibility_desc: Design focused on people with low mobility, elderly and People with Disabilities — simple and autonomous controls.

how.title: How it works | AUTOHAUS
how.description: Understand how the AUTOHAUS system works, its architecture, benefits and how it can bring autonomy to the elderly and people with reduced mobility.

hero.title: How does the system work?
hero.lead: Discover the smart system that provides autonomy and accessibility through app-controlled devices.

evolution.title: Project Evolution
evolution.lead: The project went through several iterations until reaching the current solution.

item1.title: Problem Identification
item1.desc: Exposure of the school bicycle shed to weather conditions damaging bicycles and causing inconvenience.

item2.title: First Prototype
item2.desc: Made of styrofoam with manual closing, the system had locking issues.

item3.title: Second Prototype
item3.desc: First automation tests, using recycled motors and structure made with popsicle sticks.

item4.title: Third Prototype
item4.desc: Prototype with more robust structure, using Arduino and sensors for awning control.

item5.title: Fourth Prototype
item5.desc: System adapted for use in other devices with replacement of Arduino for ESP32, app conceptualization.

item6.title: App Creation
item6.desc: Developed in Dart language, enabled device control through a homemade server.

item7.title: Complete Integration
item7.desc: Implementation of MQTT communication protocol as replacement for homemade server, use of virtual assistants and final tests of Prototype N°4.

architecture.title: System Modular Architecture
architecture.lead: The system uses a scalable architecture based on three main components that communicate through the MQTT protocol.

mqtt.title: MQTT Server
items: Manages messages between app and devices

devices.title: Smart Devices
items: Motor control for use in specific devices

operation.title: System Operation
operation.lead: AUTOHAUS operates through a combination of manual control, sensor automation and integration with virtual assistants.

manual.title: Manual Control
manual.desc: Through the app or physical buttons, the user can open and close awning or windows with percentage control.

auto.title: Automatic Mode
auto.desc: The system automatically reacts to conditions detected by sensors (rain, luminosity, etc).

schedule.title: Scheduling
schedule.desc: Schedule specific actions for determined times, such as closing the awning at dusk.

alerts.title: Smart Alerts
alerts.desc: Receive notifications when sensors detect changes in sensors (rain, luminosity).

app.title: App | AUTOHAUS
app.description: Discover the AutoHaus app for controlling smart devices, with an accessible interface and advanced features.

hero.title: Control your devices with a tap
hero.lead: The AutoHaus app offers complete control over your smart devices, with an accessible interface and various features.

screens.title: App Interface
screens.lead: Intuitive and accessible design, developed to offer the best user experience.

download.title: Download the App
download.lead: Available for Android devices. Download now and start controlling your smart devices.
download.note: Note: You need to allow installation of apps from unknown sources in your Android device settings.
